messages.message:
Hi team, I'm not sure this message lives in only one channel so posting it here.

We've seen a several bugs / UX improvement areas in the doc previewer window recently.
Do we have an active project looking at owning & redesigning/improving this feature? Which team owns it today?

This UX component is used in so many places across the platform and plays a critical role in the usability of the whole platform for every Doc Understanding Use-case we tackle. We're starting to see a slight splintering of this UX with the new Annotator App / Blueprint / "Classic" Doc Preview.

Because this is such an important component, used in so many places, when it bugs, breaks or is hard to use, it can make the whole platform feel a bit clunky and unstable.

https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CV8V33RPV/p1610722409003900
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01PQ7Z7T8X/p1620216580408100
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CJ7E9RG7Q/p1619422821129900
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CLBGA5A7K/p1620153238306500

CC @Lee @Venkatesh @John Hung @Kerry @Travis
Hey @Matt Weaver.. @Pranjal Rai is already working to fix the coordinate mismatch issue that is reported in the refiner..
For the Orientation issue Shivam can look into it.. cc: @Shivam can you pls add investigate the orientation issue reported here?
THanks @Hari. More broadly, are we looking at re-designing this component? I think there are a lot of UX improvements we could make. One is in line with @Lee's observation above, but there are more
Is it your team that owns this widget?
@Matt Weaver No! the UI widget is with Youseff!
cc: @Youssef @lydia I don’t think it’s currently being worked on but there have been a refactor of it recently
Would love any feedback you have Matt Weaver! You can drop it in a jira ticket on the doc insights board and cc me
We’re planning on some work for annotation this half, which may include some updates to the widget.

Youssef did some refactoring to it earlier this half to improve performance. The changes should be reflected in Refiner. One major improvement is to avoid re-rendering the component every time something in Refiner changes (function is updated, field is renamed, etc).

I created a Jira ticket for the zooming centered around cursor improvement here (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INSIGHTS-2061). Seems like a good KonMari week candidate. For the other 3, seems like tickets were filed. @lydia, let's chat in our upcoming 1:1 on what their priorities are and when to schedule the fixes.
with respect to `correct orientation` , @Matt Weaver if you see this in any new document, can you share the example? cc: @Venkatesh
